record.field: Artificial Intelligence in Higher Education: A Systematic Literature Review
Comprehensive Analysis of AI Applications in Academic Settings
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Sarah Johnson, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
Artificial Intelligence, Educational Technology, Machine Learning
artificial intelligence, higher education, systematic review, educational technology, machine learning
This study presents a comprehensive systematic literature review of artificial intelligence applications in higher education, analyzing 150 peer-reviewed papers from 2019-2024.

Abstract

This systematic literature review examines the current state and future prospects of artificial intelligence (AI) in higher education. We analyzed 150 peer-reviewed papers published between 2019-2024 to identify key trends, applications, and challenges. Our findings reveal that AI technologies are increasingly being integrated into various aspects of higher education, including personalized learning systems, automated assessment tools, and predictive analytics for student success.

Key Findings:

  • Machine learning algorithms show 85% accuracy in predicting student performance
  • Natural language processing improves automated essay scoring by 23%
  • AI-powered chatbots increase student engagement by 40%

The study concludes that while AI presents significant opportunities for enhancing educational outcomes, careful consideration of ethical implications and pedagogical principles is essential for successful implementation.
AI in Higher Education: Systematic Review | Computers & Education
Comprehensive systematic literature review analyzing artificial intelligence applications in higher education. Published in Computers & Education (Q1, Impact Factor 8.538).
artificial intelligence, higher education, systematic review, educational technology, Scopus Q1
Implementasi Blockchain untuk Keamanan Data IoT dalam Smart Campus
Pendekatan Hybrid untuk Meningkatkan Privasi dan Integritas Data
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Budi Santoso, S.T., M.Kom.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
Jurnal Teknologi Informasi dan Ilmu Komputer
Blockchain Technology, Internet of Things, Cybersecurity
blockchain, IoT, smart campus, keamanan data, privasi
Penelitian ini mengusulkan implementasi teknologi blockchain untuk meningkatkan keamanan data IoT dalam lingkungan smart campus dengan pendekatan hybrid yang inovatif.

Abstrak

Penelitian ini mengusulkan implementasi teknologi blockchain untuk meningkatkan keamanan data Internet of Things (IoT) dalam lingkungan smart campus. Dengan semakin berkembangnya teknologi IoT di institusi pendidikan, kebutuhan akan sistem keamanan yang robust menjadi sangat penting.

Metodologi:

Penelitian menggunakan pendekatan hybrid yang menggabungkan private blockchain dengan protokol konsensus Proof of Authority (PoA) untuk mengelola data sensor IoT di kampus. Sistem diuji pada 500 perangkat IoT yang tersebar di berbagai lokasi kampus.

Hasil:

  • Peningkatan keamanan data sebesar 94.7%
  • Reduksi latency hingga 35% dibanding sistem konvensional
  • Throughput meningkat 28% untuk transaksi data IoT

Implementasi blockchain terbukti efektif dalam menjaga integritas dan privasi data IoT di lingkungan smart campus.
Blockchain untuk Keamanan IoT Smart Campus | JTIIK
Implementasi blockchain untuk keamanan data IoT dalam smart campus. Penelitian terbaru di Jurnal Teknologi Informasi dan Ilmu Komputer (SINTA 2).
blockchain, IoT, smart campus, SINTA 2, keamanan data
Machine Learning Approach for COVID-19 Detection Using Chest X-Ray Images
Deep Learning Model with Transfer Learning Optimization
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Lisa Chen, Ph.D., Dr. Ahmad Wijaya, S.T., M.T.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
2024 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Machine Learning, Medical Diagnosis, Computer Vision
COVID-19, chest X-ray, deep learning, transfer learning, medical diagnosis
Novel deep learning approach using transfer learning for automated COVID-19 detection from chest X-ray images with 96.5% accuracy achieved in clinical validation.

Abstract

This paper presents a novel machine learning approach for automated COVID-19 detection using chest X-ray images. The proposed method leverages deep learning techniques with transfer learning optimization to achieve high accuracy in medical diagnosis.

Methodology:

We developed a convolutional neural network (CNN) model based on ResNet-50 architecture with transfer learning. The model was trained on a dataset of 15,000 chest X-ray images comprising COVID-19 positive, pneumonia, and normal cases.

Results:

  • Overall accuracy: 96.5%
  • COVID-19 detection sensitivity: 94.8%
  • Specificity: 97.2%
  • Processing time: <2 seconds per image

The proposed system demonstrates significant potential for rapid screening and diagnosis support in clinical settings, particularly valuable during pandemic situations.
ML COVID-19 Detection from Chest X-Ray | IEEE AIML 2024
Machine learning approach for COVID-19 detection using chest X-ray images. Published in IEEE International Conference on AI and ML 2024.
COVID-19, machine learning, chest X-ray, deep learning, IEEE conference
Algoritma Quantum Computing untuk Optimasi Jaringan Sensor Nirkabel
Implementasi Quantum Annealing dalam WSN Energy Optimization
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Siti Nurhaliza, S.T., M.Kom., Dr. Rama Pratama, S.Kom., M.T.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
Indonesian Journal of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
Institute of Advanced Engineering and Science
Quantum Computing, Wireless Sensor Networks, Optimization
quantum computing, wireless sensor networks, energy optimization, quantum annealing
Penelitian pionir dalam penerapan algoritma quantum computing untuk optimasi konsumsi energi pada jaringan sensor nirkabel menggunakan quantum annealing approach.

Abstrak

Penelitian ini memperkenalkan pendekatan baru dalam optimasi jaringan sensor nirkabel (WSN) menggunakan algoritma quantum computing. Dengan memanfaatkan quantum annealing, kami mengembangkan solusi untuk masalah optimasi konsumsi energi yang merupakan tantangan utama dalam WSN.

Kontribusi Utama:

1. Formulasi masalah WSN energy optimization sebagai Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization (QUBO)
2. Implementasi algoritma quantum annealing untuk menyelesaikan masalah optimasi
3. Analisis perbandingan dengan metode klasik (genetic algorithm, simulated annealing)

Hasil Eksperimen:

  • Penghematan energi: 42% dibanding algoritma klasik
  • Network lifetime meningkat 38%
  • Convergence time berkurang 65%
  • Skalabilitas hingga 1000+ sensor nodes

Penelitian ini membuka peluang baru untuk aplikasi quantum computing dalam domain Internet of Things dan sensor networks.
Quantum Computing untuk WSN Optimization | IJEECS
Algoritma quantum computing untuk optimasi jaringan sensor nirkabel. Penelitian terbaru di Indonesian Journal of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (SINTA 1).
quantum computing, WSN, SINTA 1, energy optimization, quantum annealing
Edge Computing in Industry 4.0: Challenges, Opportunities, and Future Directions
A Comprehensive Survey of Edge Computing Technologies
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Michael Schmidt, Ph.D., Dr. Yuki Tanaka, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
Edge Computing, Industry 4.0, IoT, Fog Computing
edge computing, Industry 4.0, IoT, fog computing, smart manufacturing
Comprehensive survey of edge computing technologies in Industry 4.0 context, analyzing 200+ research papers and providing future research directions for smart manufacturing.

Abstract

This comprehensive survey examines the role of edge computing in Industry 4.0 transformation. We systematically analyze over 200 research papers published between 2020-2024 to identify key challenges, opportunities, and future research directions.

Survey Scope:

The survey covers six main areas: (1) Edge computing architectures, (2) Real-time processing capabilities, (3) Security and privacy concerns, (4) Integration with existing systems, (5) Scalability issues, and (6) Economic implications.

Key Insights:

  • Edge computing reduces latency by 80% in industrial applications
  • Data processing costs decrease by 60% with edge deployment
  • Real-time decision making improves by 45% in smart factories
  • Security remains the primary concern (cited in 85% of studies)

Future Research Directions:

We identify 12 critical research areas including AI-driven edge orchestration, quantum-secure edge communications, and sustainable edge infrastructure for green manufacturing.
Edge Computing in Industry 4.0 Survey | IEEE Access
Comprehensive survey of edge computing in Industry 4.0. Published in IEEE Access (Q1, Impact Factor 3.476). Analysis of 200+ research papers.
edge computing, Industry 4.0, survey, IEEE Access, IoT, smart manufacturing
